text: Hey Mark! Thanks for the question. can you tell me a little more about that?

Sure thing.  Since I can't create a custom Section with configuration visible in the editor like I can for Modules, I'm looking for a way that I can have more control over a section and how it looks.  Right now, I can't target a specific section to style it.  Being able to add a CSS class would make that a lot easier.
Here's a page I'm playing with <http://HubSpot-developers-1w7chhd-5091472.hs-sites.com/dnd-test-page>

being able to add a class to the first Section that would allow me to style a page banner area (maybe to allow me to add a screen over the background image or have a consistent way to specify if a title should be dark or light)
Right now, I don't think I can even add a CSS class to a section in HubL
Thanks for the context! Out of curiosity, if you had to pick one, would you prefer to add that class via the page or via HubL?

Do we have to pick one? :slightly_smiling_face: Just like you can specify background image in both, it would be nice to have it both ways.  If I had to pick one, I'd do it in the editor.  But if someone is trying to build templates for marketplace or other distribution, I think HubL would be helpful.
